abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Public Enterprise
            Sector Rationalization and Privatization Technical
            Assistance Project (PATSEP) for Guinea was unsatisfactory.
            The project failed to achieve its major objectives,
            institutional development was negligible, sustainability is
            unlikely, and the performance of both the Bank and Borrower
            was unsatisfactory. Two important lessons can be learned
            from this project. First, the Bank should carefully assess
            the Government's commitment to the operation. If it is
            found to be lacking, the Bank should take the time and
            provide the resources to help strengthen the commitment,
            even if it means delaying the operation. Second, the Bank
            should improve its supervision capacity and strictly apply
            the standardized performance criteria. Procedures should be
            in place to ensure consistency of project supervision from
            one task manager to another and a smooth transition between
            task managers before reassignment.
